name: Lydia

aspects.trouble: Duty-Bound to the Point of Self-Sacrifice
other_aspects: I Am Sworn to Carry Your Burdens

stunts: Shield-Maiden: +2 to Fight when defending an ally or using a shield
Burden Bearer: Can carry extra equipment without penalty and +2 to Physique for carrying/lifting
Sworn Protector: Once per session, can take a consequence meant for the Thane
Vigilant Guard: +2 to Notice when watching for threats to her charge
notes: Lydia is assigned as housecarl when a character becomes Thane of Whiterun. She is a skilled warrior who takes her oath of service seriously, willing to follow into any danger.

relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Loyal to her Jarl, assigned by him

quests: Available as follower after becoming Thane of Whiterun

personality_notes.speaking_style: Professional, sometimes sarcastic in a dry way. 'I am sworn to carry your burdens' said with varying degrees of enthusiasm.
motivations: Fulfill her oath to serve her Thane
Protect those she's sworn to guard
Prove herself as a capable warrior
fears: Her charge being killed while she lives
quirks: Stoic and professional most of the time
Takes 'carry your burdens' literally and figuratively
Quietly loyal, actions speak louder than words

negative.action: Treat her as mere pack mule
Leave her to die in combat

recruitment.greeting: I am your housecarl. I am sworn to carry your burdens.

high_loyalty.dialogue: I would follow you anywhere, my Thane. Your enemies are mine.

low_loyalty.dialogue: I am sworn to serve... but must it always be like this?

companion_mechanics.combat_style: Tank - frontline fighter with sword and shield
companion_mechanics.preferred_tactics: Aggressive defense, protect allies, engage strongest enemies
special_abilities: Can take hits meant for player

stormcloak_side.dialogue: I serve you, my Thane, but this... this is attacking my home.

imperial_side.dialogue: I will defend Whiterun to my last breath!

story_hooks: Trained as warrior by Whiterun guard
Can become marry-able after long service
One of the most reliable companions
Will sacrifice herself to protect the Thane
Her 'burdens' line is famous but she means it sincerely
